11.content:
Max opened his door, his sister, Alex, was presumably asleep as her room was quite, it always was. Justin, Max's older brother was snoring in his sleep, and his Parent's Jerry and Theresa were also asleep. Max used magic to get downstairs and his stomach quietly rumbled
he opened the fridge and his stomach growled again, there was so much food, he'd just take some of it, he vowed not to overeat, as he remembered what happened last time, with him blowing up to the size of a house with contaminated food.
Max removed the memory from his mind, took most of the food, and used magic to get back to his room
He sat on his bed, and began eating the food, he gave a groan about 25 minutes later, his pyjama trousers were tight, he'd gotten a little bloated
"Mhmhmhmmm!" he said, his mouth full of food
he slowly drifted off to sleep
he awoke the next morning and sat up, groaning as his stomach pressed against his pyjamas, he rubbed his stomach and looked down
"I think i over ate last night..." he muttered to himself, poking his stomach slightly, he got a small blob of fat, where his thin stomach used to be
"i guess i overate more than once" he said quietly to himself, he then looked at the calender on the wall, 2 weeks left of summer vacation, he had time to lose the weight
he reached over to the bedside table and picked the remaining packet of crisps off of the counter, he tipped his head back, opened the packet and ate the crisps in one, forcing them down his throat
he gave another groan as he stood up

what happened next?

Someone he knows actually does come see him
1122.content:
Max had two weeks left until school started, but he knew that he didn't want to be in a store when it was full of parents and kids running around looking for supplies, so he and his mom went shopping early. He was still a bit groggy from waking up and filling himself up on breakfast, but he had a list of needed supplies so that he wouldn't struggle to remember.
         "Pencils, check. Paper, check. Binders, check. We got those books you're going to have to read, so...I think we're all set!" Theresa said, looking at Max's list. "Do you need any new clothes, honey?"
         "Everything from last year still fits, I think," Max replied with a definite air of boredom. "We might as well get some while we're here, I guess. I think I just saw someone I know over there. I'm gonna go say hi, so can you just grab a couple pairs of jeans and some shirts maybe?"
         Theresa sighed at being given the task to do on her own, and had to guess Max's size. She unknowingly grabbed some pants that were a size too big, and a medium button-up shirt, as well as some regular t-shirts. While she was doing this, Max had actually made his way to the food court instead of to see a friend.
         Stopping in front of a Chinese food place, Max placed a pretty sizable order considering he had just eaten his fill of breakfast an hour earlier. "Man...I love this stuff," he aloud to nobody in particular as he dug in to his meal.
1122.title: School Shopping

choices: His trousers fall down in the mall....
He makes it home with out incident to change...
11222.content:
By the time Max reached Alfred at the side of the food court, he was barely able to pass a sentence in conversation with his best friend before Alfred's mother tugged her son away to continue their errands, leaving Max to say little more than hello and goodbye in quick succession. Instead of turning back the way he came, Max trudged through the food court.

'Mom said she'd meet me in half an hour' he pondered to himself as he put his hand in his pocket. Besides the tissue, candy wrappers, there was a ten and a few bits of loose change; just about enough to buy a snack before he headed back. Knowing the food court so well, Max made a beeline for his favourite Chinese place, and placed his order - the same that he usually made.

After waiting five or so minuets for his order, he grabbed the tray and headed towards a table near the glass barrier that overlooked the mall. Before he had even put his tray down and taken a seat he could hear his stomach rumble, and dug into one of the dishes as he placed his tray on the table to sate his hunger. True, he hadn't that long had breakfast, but there was something about shopping that just left the teenage boy drained and starving. Luckily, shopping did mean he could make an excursion to the food court, so it wasn't all bad.

As he bent to place his buttocks on the seat, a muted tear alerted him to the shredding of the thread from the button of his trousers. "Crap" he muttered under his breath, putting is hand on his waist band to stop his trousers falling and exposing his underwear. He supposed it was good that his mom was probably going to buy jeans for him anyway. Anyway, as he worried pointlessly, his lunch was getting cold.
11222.title: His pants button pops off during his meal

It wasn't without some effort that Max had made it around the rest of the mall, and all the way home on the subway without his trousers slipping, but somehow he had, and he had found himself so relieved as he retreated to his bed room for a change of underwear. As he pushed his bedroom door shut, he just let his trousers fall to the floor, before stepping out of them.

Munching on a candy bar, Max riffled trough his wardrobe for a change of trousers, quickly settling on a dark pair of jeans not dissimilar to those he had just cast off. He pulled the remainder out of the chocolate out of the packet with his teeth and dropped the wrapper where he stood, and pulled the pair of jeans onto his legs and up to his waist.

1122221.content:
The jeans proved to be a tight squeeze to wrest over his bum to reach his waist; although being skinny jeans, tight was rather the point, he told himself. The real squeeze, however, proved to be on the waist band. Again. As he struggled, Max subconsciously raised his shirt and breathed in, trying, and failing, to pull the trouser button and it's hole together. After a grunt, and one last heave, he gave up and flopped on to his bed, grabbing a second candy bar from his nightstand to munch on.

His mom had thought she'd noticed that Max had had a bit of a growth spurt, for himself, Max hadn't really noticed, besides in the girth of the odd pair of the trousers. Perhaps the leg too. He had more trousers, and his mom had brought a couple of pairs of new better fitting jeans while they were out shopping. It didn't matter right now, though. He wasn't doing anything special with his afternoon, just a few hours of lounging in his bed room, movie on his TV video game on his computer.

"MAX DINNER" came his mother's call, several hours later.

The afternoon had really gone quickly. He paused the programme he'd moved on to, and set his game controller back on his desk. After brushing the small mountain of candy and crisp wrappers that he'd chomped through in the afternoon, and dashed down to his waiting dinner, not even giving his unbuttoned trousers a second thought.
1122221.title: Too tight to button up...

11222211.content:
It was just he and Justin for dinner, it seemed; Alex was out, and Mom and Dad practically at the door and on their way out as Max came down to the delightful smell of takeaway Pizza awaiting him on the table. After bidding his parents goodbye, Max didn't waist any time digging in, not before he and Justin relocated themselves, and the pizzas to the lounge.

The two brothers didn't chat much over dinner, both boys just sat, and in Max's case sprawled on the armchair and sofa eyes fixed on the TV.

Max was already chewing on the last slice of his pizza as Justin, barely even halfway through his, pace slowed and he started to leave the crusts. "God you take for ever" Max said, helping himself to a slice of his brothers.

"I had a late lunch, okay" Justin said defensively. He set down the piece of stuffed crust, and pushed the pizza box in Max's direction, "you can help yourself, I'm full."

"Awesome" Max said appreciatively.

It didn't take long for for Max to devour the remainder of Justin's pizza at a speed is if if he hadn't eaten in days, though he did stop short at the crusts his brother had cast aside. "I'm full" Max finally proclaimed under his breath, he rubbed his stomach which was starting to feel a little bloated. Perhaps he had eaten a little to much. Too late to worry about that now.

"You've eaten so much you've burst your jeans" Justin laughed, pointing out Max's exposed stomach, his round belly emerging from underneath his shirt and over the waistband of his underwear.

Max met Brad at the substation and his belly rumbled, as did Brad's

He got to his feet, and, with a groan, the belt off of his trousers, exploded open, falling to the floor. His trousers burst open and his belly bulged over the top of his trousers.
"Wow," Brad exclaimed, his eyes going wide "You've gotten fat. Sorry, Max, but, while you're this fat, I can't hang out with you,"
"Why not?" Max asked, confused.
"Because," Brad replied, lifting up his shirt and revealing his fat gut. He was plump, but was refusing to admit it "I can't let your weight issues ruin my body,"
Max rolled his eyes and crossed his arms, making himself look fatter. "What do you call this?" He grabbed Brad's belly and shook it. "Muscle," Brad commented, removing Max's hand and flexing his arms.
Max turned and ran back upstairs, panting, as Brad left the substation.
"Am I really fat?" Max asked himself, moving to the mirror.
He lifted his shirt up, revealing his fat gut.
He placed a hand on it and spoke "...

Darn it.

12.content: Justin is trying to create a new spell... what is it?
12.title: Justin

choices: Justin uses this spell and it backfires on him-
Justin decides to use the spell on himself-
121.content:
Justin sat in his room, blanket covering his body. A dim, faint light glowed under his sheets. Using his wand for light, Justin eagerly stayed up studying new spells. Turning each page his eyes rapidly took in the ink. He had stayed up for countless hours, nerves on high alert. For if his parents walked in they would surly ground him for his late night studies. Justin did not know why they were against his constant search for knowledge, it should be something all parents want for their children. Yet, there he silently laid, carefully turning the thick pages of the spell book in fear of being caught.
          After several more hours, Justin was sure he had learned a vast variety of new spells. He gave a proud smirk at the thought of using these defensive magic tactics against his younger siblings. evil sister Alex, and dim-witted brother Max. He was sure they would not be able to take him down with this new knowledge, and maybe, if he was lucky, his father would be proud of his self-taught skills.
          Closing the thick, heavy, brown leather spell book, a cloud of dust flew out. Justin began to cough as the particles infested his lungs. Justin was always a very clean person and held a deep fear for germs. Jumping up, he ran off his bed and tried to clean himself off. With fear gripping his mind, Justin felt light headed. He began to call out for help in his dying moments. Dramatically, he crashed onto the floor, his last breath leaving his lips.
          Immediately, Justin's door flew open. His mother came rushing to his aid. Brushing off the dust that covered his body, she helped him up and began to pat his back. Justin yakked up a dark cloud of dust and regained his uneven breathing.
          "Justin!" his mother, Theresa, yelled out."What happened to you?"
          Still catching his breath, Justin stammered out, "I-I was just-" he began a series of rough coughing, not from the dust but to think of a lie to cover up his actions, "was attacked by Alex!" he exclaimed.
          "Theresa what happened?" A deep voice yelled out. Running to the door was Justin's father, Jerry. Looking at Justin' covered in dirt, Jerry stuttered out "Justin - Dirt - Alex!" he called out. Justin sat silent and still. His posture perfect like a statue. The fear of his exposed lie was breaking him down. "Alex!" Jerry called out. "Get over here now!" After a few seconds of silence, Alex wobbled into the room.
          Her hair was dark as night, but was wildly in a craze as she was awakened in the hours of the night. Her eyes drooped down with sleepiness still glazed over them. Looking around she came upon the sight of Justin. Examining him, she could not help but burst out into laughter. "Don't laugh young lady." Theresa commanded. "How could you do this to your brother?"
          Taking time to understand the situation, Alex retorted, "Wait, you think I did this?"
          "Well who else could it be?" Theresa asked.
          "I don't know." Alex said. "Anyone with a life and a good sense of humor." she giggled.
          "Besides, Justin said it was you." Theresa said.
          Alex starred into Justin's brown eyes. She could see right through them. Looking at his bed, Alex caught sight of something large underneath Justin's sheets. Grinning, she walked over to it and unveiled his covers. Lying there, was the ancient, large book of spells covered in dust. "Ah, I see someone is dabbling into the art of lying." she mockingly said. Justin shot his eyes down to the floor, he could not take the glares of his parents upon him.
          "Justin, did you lie about this?" his father asked. Unable to look at him, Justin nodded his head.
          "And you blamed it on your sister?" said Theresa. Again, all Justin could do was nod.
          "Well," Alex said, "I'm going back to bed. Good job Justin, next time just hide the evidence."
          We will talk about this in the morning." Justin's mother said walking out of the room along with his father.
          Sitting, still covered in dirt, Justin grew with anger. He knew it was wrong to have blamed Alex, but how many times had she gotten his into trouble? How many times had she blamed him on things? Clenching his wand, Justin thought of the new magic he had previously learned, and came upon the thought of using one new spell, specifically for Alex.

12113.content:
Coming back into reality, Justin awoke from his slumber. He let out a deep sigh thinking back to the events of last night. He boiled with rage, sitting up, jaw clenched, he grew with quick malice towards Alex, but soon smirked remembering the little spell he had given her. He knew it was wrong, yet he did not mind. She deserved it after all. He was the good child, studying for the wizarding exams, unlike his sister and brother.
          Getting up, Justin felt a deep roar from below. Looking down, he placed his hand over his slim, firm stomach. Waiting he heard the rumble once again. "I must be hungry." he mused. Walking to the bathroom, to perform his orderly rituals of cleanliness, Justin felt his belly hollow. It was a strange felling that left his with almost a strike of pain inside. Without realizing it, Justin was in the kitchen.
          His mouth was practically open wide starring into the fridge. He knew that his mother would not wake up for hours, as he was the first to always wake up in his family, so Justin decided to take it upon himself to eat breakfast. Looking at his vast choices, Justin started with some cereal.
He never felt such a rush. Once it entered into his mouth he was sent into heaven. Justin could not believe the sense of joy he got from eating. He must have been depriving himself of food over the past few days of studying, he thought. Slurping down the last of the milk, Justin still felt the empty feeling in his stomach. Refilling his bowl, Justin ate it faster than before, still enjoying every bit of it, but once again found himself still hungry.
          "Wow, I guess I need something a bit more filling." he whispered to himself. "Maybe a sandwich from downstairs will be better..." Heading down to his family's sandwich shop kitchen, Justin mentally prepared his meal.
          He would stuff it with assortments of meats, lathered in mustard, tucked in with cheese, and lightly covered with lettuce, all wrapped in-between two warm buns. He practically drooled at the thought. Once in the kitchen Justin took no time in preparing is concoction. He found himself stuffing his mouth with ingredients while preparing his sandwich. With gleeful eyes, Justin gazed at his creation. It was much bigger than he thought of, his mouth barely able to even fit a bit in. With it divine taste entering his mouth, Justin let out a small giggle of joy. He ate with pure satisfaction, even licking his fingers once done.
          Justin patted his belly, which slightly bulged out, as the empty feeling diminished away. "I need to make sure I get proper nutrition when I study." he told himself. Walking back upstairs Justin ripped out a loud belch, "BURP!" Frozen with embarrassment, Justin heard something....

1211311.content:
Zeke stopped, staring. "Umm... what are you doing?" Justin blushed. Here he was in the sub shop, in his pajamas, his stomach bowing slightly outward, due to the extra food in it. "I... I was j-just eating a, uh, sandwich. A little too much swallowed air, you know? I just burped is all." Justin's ears flared bright red. Zeke looked disgusted. "A sandwich? For breakfast?" A mischievous twinkle entered his eye. "Let me fix you a real breakfast at my house!"

Justin was so relieved, he forgot to tell Zeke that he was already full.

***An hour later***

"Woah!" Justin stared at the mounds of food. There was at least enough for 3 maybe 4 people. Egg sandwiches, pancakes, waffles, french toast, bacon, and sausage lie across the table. Their scents mingled and teased Justin's nose. His mouth watered, and his stomach growled in anticipation. "That's a lot, man!"

"I know", smiled Zeke, proudly. "I figured if you were hungry enough to eat a sandwich, and not even a breakfast one at that, then you were in need of help. And here's your help! Dig in!"

"Don't mind if I do!", muttered Justin, ignoring the heavy, fullness in his belly.
